sources.data_found: DataUSA (IPEDS 2022): 562 Master's degrees awarded in Computer & Information Sciences. 8 Research Doctorates awarded in Computer & Information Sciences.

student_data.notes: Undergraduate count estimated from Common Data Set 2023-24: 2,298 total bachelor's degrees × 14.8% (CIS share) = 340 degrees/year; 340 × 4 years = 1,360 est. enrollment. Graduate count estimated from IPEDS/DataUSA (2022): 562 Master's degrees awarded × 2 years duration = 1,124 est. enrollment. PhD count estimated from 8 doctorates awarded (DataUSA 2022) × 5 years duration = 40. [WARNING: Original source was inaccessible, using fallback.]

gpu_resources.notes: Pace University has a small central HPC footprint (Ryo Cluster). The documentation explicitly lists only 1 GPU node equipped with 2x NVIDIA Tesla V100 32GB GPUs. No public evidence was found of H100/A100 clusters or other large-scale GPU resources in the central research computing facility. [WARNING: Original source was inaccessible, using fallback.]

compute_credits.description: No specific dollar values for cloud compute credits found in public documentation.

analysis_notes: Pace University's Seidenberg School has a large student population relative to its on-premise HPC resources, suggesting reliance on cloud resources, local workstations (not listed in HPC specs), or external partnerships. The only verifiable central HPC resource is the Ryo cluster's V100 node.
